Articles.Content:
Okay, so I was watching

video by Scott Manley, and he mentioned that subassembly functionality will be added in .22

Can anyone confirm this/find the source where it was said?

Okay, so I was watching
video by Scott Manley, and he mentioned that subassembly functionality will be added in .22

Can anyone confirm this/find the source where it was said?

Here you go:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/subassembly-manager/

He had the spaceport search names down in the description. I'm glad he showcased these, because I've been looking for working versions for a long time!

I think that the OP wa asking if a stock subassembly was going to be added in 0.22?

I think....

Here you go:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/subassembly-manager/

He had the spaceport search names down in the description. I'm glad he showcased these, because I've been looking for working versions for a long time!

Sorry if I missed something, but the OP was asking for proof if that mod was going to be in the next update.

I think that the OP wa asking if a stock subassembly was going to be added in 0.22?

I think....

Yes, I was. Sorry for the vagueness . . .
What I got from it, is that he said he thinks it.
Well, that's what Scott said that he heard another person say, so while there's definitely a base for a rumor here, I wouldn't count on it being a certainty until further proof.
Well, he mentioned something about a leak, but I have no idea what he's referring to . . .

I watched the vid earlier today, if I recall, I believe he said he Hopes for Stock Subassemblys.

EDIT: I just rewatched the Video and Scott said that, MaxMaps had told him that there would be a Squad Subassembly in stock .22

To MaxMaps or any Moderator who reads this, "I am not myself making a claim of a future feature, I am simply paraphrasing Scott Manley in Indirect Speech of Scott Manley's words. I also do not want to offend Scott Manley by this as I truly enjoy his videos very much."

Edited August 6, 2013 by TheTriniFlyer
Clearification

I'll try to transcribe what he actually said.

A word of warning is that this is, um, ...probably gonna be made redundant in the next version, supposedly, because one hint that was (led? layed?) out by Maxmaps was that .22 will contain an official Squad version of the Subassembly Saver and Loader, so - you might want to wait until then, or you might want to just build all your stuff now and find out that it's incompatible later..

So he sounds fairly certain based on what he knows.

I'll try to transcribe what he actually said.

Thank you. Does anyone know where the post by MaxMaps that says this is?

Thank you. Does anyone know where the post by MaxMaps that says this is?

I'm thinking he may have had that discussion in person.

edit: Especially after checking out his post history: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/member.php/67937-Maxmaps

Edited August 6, 2013 by air805ronin
agree. I only use two mods: hyperedit (for testing massive modular ships) and subssembly. sooo useful.
I believe Maxmaps posted it on Twitter.

I believe Maxmaps posted it on Twitter.

Can't seem to find it . . .
Hah, yes, seems I misread the original post! I am indeed looking forward to stock subassembly functionality in .22!
For those of us (me) who just started the game, whats a sub assembly?
I really hope it is true

For those of us (me) who just started the game, whats a sub assembly?

Right now in the game, you can't save a part of your spacecraft to reuse on other spacecraft. For instance, you can't build a probe, and then load that probe for attaching to different launch vehicles.

Check out this video from Scott Manley for an excellent mod though that allows you to do things like that (skip to 7 minutes, 55 seconds if it doesn't start out there).
Nothing is officially in until you see 0.22.0 released.
I hope they add http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/editor-extensions/ too

Nothing is officially in until you see 0.22.0 released.

I think and hope most people understand this... I think right now we are looking for what is officially planned to be in .22. What actually ends up in .22 is of course not solid until .22 releases...

Subassembly Loader is the one mod I update on my own every time KSP is updated because... well because I HATE REINVENTING THE WHEEL. If you find a subassembly that works it's daft to keep rebuilding it from scratch. If it makes it into the stock build I will be a very happy Kerbonaut.

I also move the jigsaw to the lower left corner of the VAB so I don't accidentally drop parts onto the save button by mistake (which deletes the part you were trying to save... bug there for sure).

Subassembly Loader is the one mod I update on my own every time KSP is updated because... well because I HATE REINVENTING THE WHEEL. If you find a subassembly that works it's daft to keep rebuilding it from scratch. If it makes it into the stock build I will be a very happy Kerbonaut.

I also move the jigsaw to the lower left corner of the VAB so I don't accidentally drop parts onto the save button by mistake (which deletes the part you were trying to save... bug there for sure).

Not sure what you're updating in that case - the renewed Subassembly Saver&Loader plugin doesn't have the jigsaw button.

If this actually happens I really hope they fix they way struts are saved. I tried different versions of sub assembly loader but for some reason it never correctely loads struts that connect to other parts that have some open space in between. For example tying down asparagus stages with horizontal struts, when I load that from sub-assembly it only loads the struts that are connecting pieces vertically.

Edited August 7, 2013 by DeepSpaceDutch
